name: Bit Bag
features: Automatically re-stocks and stores bits that you pick up and use.
Holds 63 stacks of bits inside of it.
Stores 512 ( by default ) bits per stack, instead of 64.
Has a button which allows you to clear the contents of the bag easily.
Combine and sort its contents with a button.
Drag a stack of bits over the delete button to delete only those bits.
Craft with any dye to color the bag, craft a dyed bag with a water bucket to remove dye.

name: Diamond Chisel
features: Can chisel up to 1561 blocks by default
Allows removing bits from blocks in the world.
Has various modes, single bit, line, plane, and more.
Can harvest any material that requires a diamond pick.

name: Single Use Pattern
features: Allows for the placement of chiseled blocks straight from the bits in your inventory.
Made by writing down the chiseling of an already existing chiseled block with the help of a quill.
Simply hold a piece of paper in one hand, and the quill in another. Press right click to write the pattern.
Modifications to the pattern can be made in the modification table.

controls.action: Single use placement of the pattern. Will destroy the pattern.
When holding a sealant in your other hand, the pattern will be sealed and made ready for multiple uses.

name: Multi Use Pattern
features: Allows for the placement of chiseled blocks straight from the bits in your inventory.
Made by sealing in a single use pattern using sealant.
Can not be modified.

name: Tape Measure
features: Measure Distances using 3 modes.
Bit Mode: Measures bit level distances as a 3d cube.
Block Mode: Measures block level distances as a 3d cube.
Distance Mode; Measures the distance between the start and end point at a bit level.

controls.action: Mark start and end points of measurements.

name: Magnifying Glass
features: Allows you to easily figure out what block is chiselable.

name: Quill
features: Used to write down patterns on a piece of paper.

controls.button: Right Click /w a piece of Paper in other Hand
controls.action: Writes down the pattern of the chiseled block you are looking at.

name: Sealant
features: Used to seal your single use pattern so that you can reuse the resulting pattern.

controls.button: Right Click /w Single Use Pattern in other Hand
controls.action: Seals the pattern in your other hand.

name: Sealant remover
features: Used to remove a previously applied seal from a sealed pattern.

controls.button: Right Click /w Sealed Pattern in other Hand
controls.action: Removes the seal from the pattern in your other hand.

name: Wrench
features: Used to modify already placed bit blocks in the same way the modification table can modify patterns.

controls.action: Applies the current modification mode to the targeted block.
Opens up the modification selection menu.
